intro: Phyllis pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered phyllis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Phyllis pauciflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
